member.name: T:EditorDBF.DbfColumn
member.summary: This class represents a DBF Column.
member.remarks: Note that certain properties can not be modified after creation of the object. This is because we are locking the header object after creation of a data row, and columns are part of the header so either we have to have a lock field for each column, or make it so that certain properties such as length can only be set during creation of a column. Otherwise a user of this object could modify a column that belongs to a locked header and thus corrupt the DBF file.

member.name: T:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType
member.summary:
Great information on DBF located here: http://www.clicketyclick.dk/databases/xbase/format/data_types.html http://www.clicketyclick.dk/databases/xbase/format/dbf.html
also take a look at this: http://www.dbase.com/Knowledgebase/INT/db7_file_fmt.htm

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType.Character
member.summary:
C Character All OEM code page characters - padded with blanks to the width of the field. Character less than 254 length ASCII text less than 254 characters long in dBASE.
Character fields can be up to 32 KB long (in Clipper and FoxPro) using decimal count as high byte in field length. It's possible to use up to 64KB long fields by reading length as unsigned.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType.Number
member.summary:
Number Length: less than 18 ASCII text up till 18 characters long (include sign and decimal point).
Valid characters: "0" - "9" and "-". Number fields can be up to 20 characters long in FoxPro and Clipper.
member.remarks: We are not enforcing this 18 char limit.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType.Boolean
member.summary:
L Logical Length: 1 Boolean/byte (8 bit)
Legal values: ? Not initialised (default) Y,y Yes N,n No F,f False T,t True Logical fields are always displayed using T/F/?. Some sources claims that space (ASCII 20h) is valid for not initialised. Space may occur, but is not defined.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType.Date
member.summary: D Date Length: 8 Date in format YYYYMMDD. A date like 0000-00- 00 is *NOT* valid.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType.Memo
member.summary: M Memo Length: 10 Pointer to ASCII text field in memo file 10 digits representing a pointer to a DBT block (default is blanks).

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType.Binary
member.summary: B Binary (dBASE V) Like Memo fields, but not for text processing.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType.Integer
member.summary: I Integer Length: 4 byte little endian integer (FoxPro)

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType.Float
member.summary:
F Float Number stored as a string, right justified, and padded with blanks to the width of the field. example: value = " 2.40000000000e+001" Length=19 Decimal_Count=11
This type was added in DBF V4.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn._name
member.summary: Column (field) name

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn._type
member.summary: Field Type (Char, number, boolean, date, memo, binary)

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn._dataAddress
member.summary: Offset from the start of the record

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn._length
member.summary: Length of the data in bytes; some rules apply which are in the spec (read more above).

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfColumn._decimalCount
member.summary: Decimal precision count, or number of digits afer decimal point. This applies to Number types only.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.#ctor(System.String,EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Full spec constructor sets all relevant fields.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.#ctor(System.String,EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new column fully specifying all properties.
member.param: field length including decimal places and decimal point if any

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.Name
member.summary: Field Name.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.ColumnType
member.summary: Field Type (C N L D or M).

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.ColumnTypeChar
member.summary: Returns column type as a char, (as written in the DBF column header) N=number, C=char, B=binary, L=boolean, D=date, I=integer, M=memo

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DataAddress
member.summary: Field Data Address offset from the start of the record.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.Length
member.summary: Length of the data in bytes.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DecimalCount
member.summary: Field decimal count in Binary, indicating where the decimal is.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.GetDbaseType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns corresponding dbf field type given a .net Type.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.ShapeField
member.summary: Returns shp file Shape Field.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfColumn.IdField
member.summary: Returns Shp file ID field.

member.name: T:EditorDBF.DbfFile
member.summary: This class represents a DBF file. You can create new, open, update and save DBF files using this class and supporting classes. Also, this class supports reading/writing from/to an internet forward only type of stream!
member.remarks: TODO: add end of file byte '0x1A' !!! We don't relly on that byte at all, and everything works with or without that byte, but it should be there by spec.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfFile._header
member.summary: Helps read/write dbf file header information.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfFile._headerWritten
member.summary: flag that indicates whether the header was written or not...

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfFile._dbfFile
member.summary: Streams to read and write to the DBF file.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfFile.encoding
member.summary: By default use windows 1252 code page encoding.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfFile._fileName
member.summary: File that was opened, if one was opened at all.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfFile._recordsReadCount
member.summary: Number of records read using ReadNext() methods only. This applies only when we are using a forward-only stream. mRecordsReadCount is used to keep track of record index. With a seek enabled stream, we can always calculate index using stream position.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfFile._isForwardOnly
member.summary: keep these values handy so we don't call functions on every read.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Open a DBF from a FileStream. This can be a file or an internet connection stream. Make sure that it is positioned at start of DBF file. Reading a DBF over the internet we can not determine size of the file, so we support HasMore(), ReadNext() interface. RecordCount information in header can not be trusted always, since some packages store 0 there.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Open(System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileShare)
member.summary: Open a DBF file or create a new one.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Open(System.String,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess)
member.summary: Open a DBF file or create a new one.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Open(System.String,System.IO.FileMode)
member.summary: Open a DBF file or create a new one.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Create(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new DBF 4 file. Overwrites if file exists! Use Open() function for more options.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Close
member.summary: Update header info, flush buffers and close streams. You should always call this method when you are done with a DBF file.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfFile.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Returns true if we can not write to the DBF file stream.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfFile.IsForwardOnly
member.summary: Returns true if we can not seek to different locations within the file, such as internet connections.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfFile.FileName
member.summary: Returns the name of the filestream.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.ReadNext(EditorDBF.DbfRecord)
member.summary: Read next record and fill data into parameter oFillRecord. Returns true if a record was read, otherwise false.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.ReadNext
member.summary: Tries to read a record and returns a new record object or null if nothing was read.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Read(System.Int64,EditorDBF.DbfRecord)
member.summary: Reads a record specified by index into oFillRecord object. You can use this method to read in and process records without creating and discarding record objects. Note that you should check that your stream is not forward-only! If you have a forward only stream, use ReadNext() functions.
member.param: Record object to fill, must have same size and number of fields as thid DBF file header!
member.remarks: True if read a record was read, otherwise false. If you read end of file false will be returned and oFillRecord will NOT be modified! The parameter record (oFillRecord) must match record size specified by the header and number of columns as well. It does not have to come from the same header, but it must match the structure. We are not going as far as to check size of each field. The idea is to be flexible but safe. It's a fine balance, these two are almost always at odds.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Read(System.Int64)
member.summary: Reads a record specified by index. This method requires the stream to be able to seek to position. If you are using a http stream, or a stream that can not stream, use ReadNext() methods to read in all records.
member.returns: Null if record can not be read, otherwise returns a new record.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Write(EditorDBF.DbfRecord)
member.summary: Write a record to file. If RecordIndex is present, record will be updated, otherwise a new record will be written. Header will be output first if this is the first record being writen to file. This method does not require stream seek capability to add a new record.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Update(EditorDBF.DbfRecord)
member.summary: Update a record. RecordIndex (zero based index) must be more than -1, otherwise an exception is thrown. You can also use Write method which updates a record if it has RecordIndex or adds a new one if RecordIndex == -1. RecordIndex is set automatically when you call any Read() methods on this class.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfFile.WriteHeader
member.summary: Save header to file. Normally, you do not have to call this method, header is saved automatically and updated when you close the file (if it changed).

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfFile.Header
member.summary: Access DBF header with information on columns. Use this object for faster access to header. Remove one layer of function calls by saving header reference and using it directly to access columns.

member.name: T:EditorDBF.DbfHeader
member.summary: This class represents a DBF IV file header.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.FileDescriptorSize
member.summary: Header file descriptor size is 33 bytes (32 bytes + 1 terminator byte), followed by column metadata which is 32 bytes each.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.ColumnDescriptorSize
member.summary: Field or DBF Column descriptor is 32 bytes long.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfHeader._isDirty
member.summary: When object is modified dirty flag is set.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfHeader._emptyRecord
member.summary: mEmptyRecord is an array used to clear record data in CDbf4Record. This is shared by all record objects, used to speed up clearing fields or entire record.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Specify initial column capacity.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.HeaderLength
member.summary: Gets header length.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.AddColumn(EditorDBF.DbfColumn)
member.summary: Add a new column to the DBF header.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.AddColumn(System.String,EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType)
member.summary: Create and add a new column with specified name and type.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.AddColumn(System.String,EditorDBF.DbfColumn.DbfColumnType,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create and add a new column with specified name, type, length, and decimal precision.
member.param: Field name. Uniqueness is not enforced.
Length of the field including decimal point and decimal numbers
Number of decimal places to keep.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.RemoveColumn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove column from header definition.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Look up a column index by name. NOT Case Sensitive. This is a change from previous behaviour!

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns column at specified index. Index is 0 based.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.FindColumn(System.String)
member.summary: Finds a column index by using a fast dictionary lookup-- creates column dictionary on first use. Returns -1 if not found. CHANGE: not case sensitive any longer!
member.returns: column index (0 based) or -1 if not found.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.EmptyDataRecord
member.summary: Returns an empty data record. This is used to clear columns
member.remarks: The reason we put this in the header class is because it allows us to use the CDbf4Record class in two ways. 1. we can create one instance of the record and reuse it to write many records quickly clearing the data array by bitblting to it. 2. we can create many instances of the record (a collection of records) and have only one copy of this empty dataset for all of them. If we had put it in the Record class then we would be taking up twice as much space unnecessarily. The empty record also fits the model and everything is neatly encapsulated and safe.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.ColumnCount
member.summary: Returns Number of columns in this dbf header.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.RecordLength
member.summary: Size of one record in bytes. All fields + 1 byte delete flag.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.RecordCount
member.summary: Get/Set number of records in the DBF.
member.remarks: The reason we allow client to set RecordCount is beause in certain streams like internet streams we can not update record count as we write out records, we have to set it in advance, so client has to be able to modify this property.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.Locked
member.summary: Get/set whether this header is read only or can be modified. When you create a CDbfRecord object and pass a header to it, CDbfRecord locks the header so that it can not be modified any longer. in order to preserve DBF integrity.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.Unlock
member.summary: Use this method with caution. Headers are locked for a reason, to prevent DBF from becoming corrupt.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.IsDirty
member.summary: Returns true when this object is modified after read or write.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.Write(System.IO.BinaryWriter)
member.summary: Encoding must be ASCII for this binary writer.
member.remarks: See class remarks for DBF file structure.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfHeader.Read(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Read header data, make sure the stream is positioned at the start of the file to read the header otherwise you will get an exception. When this function is done the position will be the first record.

member.name: T:EditorDBF.DbfRecord
member.summary:
Use this class to create a record and write it to a dbf file. You can use one record object to write all records!! It was designed for this kind of use. You can do this by clearing the record of all data (call Clear() method) or setting values to all fields again, then write to dbf file. This eliminates creating and destroying objects and optimizes memory use.
Once you create a record the header can no longer be modified, since modifying the header would make a corrupt DBF file.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfRecord._header
member.summary: Header provides information on all field types, sizes, precision and other useful information about the DBF.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfRecord._data
member.summary: Dbf data are a mix of ASCII characters and binary, which neatly fit in a byte array. BinaryWriter would esentially perform the same conversion using the same Encoding class.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfRecord._recordIndex
member.summary: Zero based record index. -1 when not set, new records for example.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfRecord._emptyRecord
member.summary: Empty Record array reference used to clear fields quickly (or entire record).

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfRecord._allowStringTruncate
member.summary: Specifies whether we allow strings to be truncated. If false and string is longer than we can fit in the field, an exception is thrown.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfRecord._allowDecimalTruncate
member.summary: Specifies whether we allow the decimal portion of numbers to be truncated. If false and decimal digits overflow the field, an exception is thrown.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfRecord._allowIntegerTruncate
member.summary: Specifies whether we allow the integer portion of numbers to be truncated. If false and integer digits overflow the field, an exception is thrown.

member.name: F:EditorDBF.DbfRecord._colNameToIdx
member.summary: Column Name to Column Index map

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.#ctor(EditorDBF.DbfHeader)
member.param: Dbf Header will be locked once a record is created since the record size is fixed and if the header was modified it would corrupt the DBF file.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set string data to a column, if the string is longer than specified column length it will be truncated! If dbf column type is not a string, input will be treated as dbf column type and if longer than length an exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Set string data to a column, if the string is longer than specified column length it will be truncated! If dbf column type is not a string, input will be treated as dbf column type and if longer than length an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.GetDateValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get date value.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.SetDateValue(System.Int32,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Get date value.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.Clear
member.summary: Clears all data in the record.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.ToString
member.summary: returns a string representation of this record.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.RecordIndex
member.summary: Gets/sets a zero based record index. This information is not directly stored in DBF. It is the location of this record within the DBF.
member.remarks: This property is managed from outside this object, CDbfFile object updates it when records are read. The reason we don't set it in the Read() function within this object is that the stream can be forward-only so the Position property is not available and there is no way to figure out what index the record was unless you count how many records were read, and that's exactly what CDbfFile does.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.IsDeleted
member.summary: Returns/sets flag indicating whether this record was tagged deleted.
member.remarks: Use CDbf4File.Compress() function to rewrite dbf removing records flagged as deleted.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.AllowStringTurncate
member.summary: Specifies whether strings can be truncated. If false and string is longer than can fit in the field, an exception is thrown. Default is True.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.AllowDecimalTruncate
member.summary: Specifies whether to allow the decimal portion of numbers to be truncated. If false and decimal digits overflow the field, an exception is thrown. Default is false.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.AllowIntegerTruncate
member.summary: Specifies whether integer portion of numbers can be truncated. If false and integer digits overflow the field, an exception is thrown. Default is False.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.Header
member.summary: Returns header object associated with this record.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.Column(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get column by index.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.Column(System.String)
member.summary: Get column by name.

member.name: P:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.ColumnCount
member.summary: Gets column count from header.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.FindColumn(System.String)
member.summary: Finds a column index by searching sequentially through the list. Case is ignored. Returns -1 if not found.
member.returns: Column index (0 based) or -1 if not found.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.Write(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Writes data to stream. Make sure stream is positioned correctly because we simply write out the data to it.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.Write(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes data to stream. Make sure stream is positioned correctly because we simply write out data to it, and clear the record.

member.name: M:EditorDBF.DbfRecord.Read(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read record from stream. Returns true if record read completely, otherwise returns false.
